text:
Jamie Lee Curtis and Jane Fonda at the Womenâ€™s March in Los Angeles. Broadimage/REX/Shutterstock 12 Photos January 21, 2017 will be remembered as the day that hundreds of thousands of men and women participated in the Womenâ€™s Marches around the world. The protest, which stands for the protection of citizenâ€™s rights, safety, health, and families, recognizes that diverse communities are the strength of our country. Marches took place in Washington D.C., Park City, Utah were the Sundance Film Festival is taking place, Los Angeles, Chicago and many other cities. Among those involved in the Womenâ€™s Marches included Chelsea Handler, Charlize Theron , Jane Fonda, Jamie Lee Curtis and Janelle MonÃ¡e, among many others, with many speaking at the events or walking alongside other women and men to protest Donald Trump. Janelle MonÃ¡e speaks during the Womenâ€™s March in Washington. Jose Luis Magana/AP/REX/Shutterstock Mary McCormack and Charlize Theron at the Womenâ€™s March at Sundance. Chelsea Lauren/REX/Shutterstock Madonna speaks with Michael Moore during the Womenâ€™s March in Washington. Jose Luis Magana/AP/REX/Shutterstock Many other indie and notable celebrities also participated in the dayâ€™s events by tweeting, sharing photos and rallying.
